1.name: The Diary of Anne Frank
1.description: During World War II, a teenage Jewish girl named Anne Frank and her family are forced into hiding in the Nazi-occupied Netherlands.

2.name: Some Like It Hot
2.description: When two male musicians witness a mob hit, they flee the state in an all-female band disguised as women, but further complications set in.

3.name: Ben-Hur
3.description: When a Jewish prince is betrayed and sent into slavery by a Roman friend, he regains his freedom and comes back for revenge.

4.name: North by Northwest
4.description: A hapless New York City advertising executive is mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies, and is pursued across the country while he looks for a way to survive.

5.name: The Mating Game
5.description: An uptight IRS agent is ordered to investigate a rural family in debt to the government...but the family - including lovely daughter Mariette - help him loosen up.

6.name: Sleeping Beauty
6.description: After being snubbed by the royal family, a malevolent fairy places a curse on a princess which only a prince can break, along with the help of three good fairies.

7.name: Rio Bravo
7.description: A small-town sheriff in the American West enlists the help of a cripple, a drunk, and a young gunfighter in his efforts to hold in jail the brother of the local bad guy.

8.name: A Bucket of Blood
8.description: A dim-witted busboy finds acclaim as an artist for a plaster-covered dead cat that is mistaken as a skillful statuette. The desire for more praise soon leads to an increasingly deadly series of works.

9.name: Anatomy of a Murder
9.description: In a murder trial, the defendant says he suffered temporary insanity after the victim raped his wife. What is the truth, and will he win his case?

10.name: Les quatre cents coups
10.description: A young boy, left without attention, delves into a life of petty crime.

11.name: Journey to the Center of the Earth
11.description: An Edinburgh professor and assorted colleagues follow an explorer's trail down an extinct Icelandic volcano to the earth's center.

12.name: Carry on Nurse
12.description: Set in Haven Hospital where a certain men's ward is causing more havoc than the whole hospital put together. The formidable Matron's debut gives the patients a chill every time she walks ...                See full summary »

13.name: The Best of Everything
13.description: An expose of the lives and loves of Madison Avenue working girls and their higher ups.

14.name: Gidget
14.description: A young girl discovers surfing and love (in that order) during one transitive summer.

15.name: House on Haunted Hill
15.description: A millionaire offers $10,000 to five people who agree to be locked in a large, spooky, rented house overnight with him and his wife.

16.name: Ride Lonesome
16.description: A bounty hunter escorts a killer to be tried for murder, but allows the man's outlaw brother to catch up with them to have a showdown over a previous shocking murder.

17.name: Plan 9 from Outer Space
17.description: Evil aliens attack Earth and set their terrible "Plan 9" in action. As the aliens resurrect the dead of the Earth to destroy the living, our lives are in danger.

18.name: Imitation of Life
18.description: An aspiring actress befriends a black widow, but trouble arises when the latter is rejected by her daughter, who tries to pass for white.

19.name: Suddenly, Last Summer
19.description: The only son of wealthy widow Violet Venable dies while on vacation with his cousin Catherine. What the girl saw was so horrible that she went insane; now Mrs. Venable wants Catherine lobotomized to cover up the truth.

20.name: On the Beach
20.description: After a global nuclear war, the residents of Australia must come to terms with the fact that all life will be destroyed in a matter of months.

21.name: Hiroshima mon amour
21.description: A French actress filming an anti-war film in Hiroshima has an affair with a married Japanese architect as they share their differing perspectives on war.

22.name: The Wonderful Country
22.description: A honorable drifter constantly on the run finds his enemies closing in around him.

23.name: The Hanging Tree
23.description: Character study of a Doctor who saves a local criminal from a mob who are trying to hang him, but then tries to control the life of the young man, realizing that he can exploit his secret.

24.name: Darby O'Gill and the Little People
24.description: A wily old codger matches wits with the king of the leprechauns and helps play matchmaker for his daughter and the strapping lad who has replaced him as caretaker.

25.name: The Horse Soldiers
25.description: In 1863, a Union outfit is sent behind Confederate lines in Mississippi to destroy enemy railroads but a captive southern belle and the unit's doctor cause frictions within ranks.

26.name: Operation Petticoat
26.description: During World War II, a commander finds himself stuck with a decrepit (and pink) submarine, a con man executive officer, and a group of army nurses.

27.name: Idol on Parade
27.description: A rock'n'roll idol is drafted into the wrong regiment.

28.name: Pillow Talk
28.description: A man and a woman who share a party line cannot stand each other, but he has fun romancing her with his voice disguised.

29.name: Solomon and Sheba
29.description: After becoming king of ancient Israel, Solomon faces threats coming from his jealous dispossessed brother Adonijah, the Egyptian Pharaoh and the scheming Queen of Sheba.

30.name: Orfeu Negro
30.description: A retelling of the Orpheus and Eurydice myth, set during the time of the Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro.

31.name: The Bridal Path
31.description: Based on a novel by Nigel Tranter, The Bridal Path is a light-hearted look at the somewhat unfortunate results that can come of the continued marrying of fairly close cousins in a ...                See full summary »

32.name: The Nun's Story
32.description: After leaving a wealthy Belgian family to become a nun, Sister Luke struggles with her devotion to her vows during crisis, disappointment, and World War II.

33.name: Pork Chop Hill
33.description: During the Korean War peace talks, U.S. troops fight to retake a hill from the Communist Chinese forces.

34.name: A Summer Place
34.description: A self-made businessman rekindles a romance with a former flame while their two teenage children begin a romance of their own with drastic consequences for both couples.

35.name: Ningen no jôken
35.description: A Japanese pacifist, unable to face the dire consequences of conscientious objection, is transformed by his attempts to compromise with the demands of war-time Japan.

36.name: Li'l Abner
36.description: As Sadie Hawkins Day approaches, Daisy Mae hopes to win the hand of Li'l Abner by catching him in the traditional race. A senator comes to visit to tell the residents of Dogpatch that their...                See full summary »

37.name: The Hound of the Baskervilles
37.description: When a nobleman is threatened by a family curse on his newly inherited estate, detective Sherlock Holmes is hired to investigate.

38.name: Behemoth the Sea Monster
38.description: Marine atomic tests cause changes in the ocean's ecosystem resulting in dangerous blobs of radiation and the resurrection of a dormant dinosaur that threatens London.

39.name: Porgy and Bess
39.description: A woman whose past is scorned by nearly everyone around her meets a man who'd love her regardlessly- if only everyone else would allow them to.

40.name: Westbound
40.description: In 1864 Capt. John Hayes goes to Colorado to take over the stagecoach line and keep the flow of Western gold flowing and help the North win the Civil War.

41.name: Pickpocket
41.description: Michel is released from jail after serving a sentence for thievery. His mother dies and he resorts to pickpocketing as a means of survival.

42.name: The Bat
42.description: A crazed killer known as "The Bat" is on the loose in a mansion full of people.

43.name: Warlock
43.description: A famous gunman becomes the marshal of Warlock to end a gang's rampages, but is met with some opposition by a former gang member turned deputy sheriff who wants to follow only legal methods.

44.name: Please Turn Over
44.description: The orderly suburban life of a 1950's English town is turned on its head when the teenaged daughter of one of the residents writes a steamy bestseller featuring characters obviously based ...                See full summary »

45.name: The Wasp Woman
45.description: A scientist develops a youth formula for a cosmetics queen from jelly taken from queen wasps, failing to anticipate the typical horrible side effects.

46.name: The Jayhawkers!
46.description: Before the U.S. Civil War rebel leader Luke Darcy sees himself as leader of a new independent Republic of Kansas but the military governor sends an ex-raider to capture Darcy.

47.name: Odds Against Tomorrow
47.description: Dave Burke hires two very different debt-burdened men for a bank robbery. Suspicion and prejudice threaten to end their partnership.

48.name: Green Mansions
48.description: A young man in the jungles of Venezuela meets a strange girl of the forest and falls in love with her.

49.name: Room at the Top
49.description: An ambitious young accountant plots to wed a wealthy factory owner's daughter, despite falling in love with a married older woman.

50.name: The Shaggy Dog
50.description: A teenage boy is cursed with periodically turning into an sheepdog.
